# duplocloud_valkey_serverless (Resource)

`duplocloud_valkey_serverless` used to manage Serverless Valkey within a DuploCloud-managed environment.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "duplocloud_tenant" "myapp" {
  account_name = "myapp"
  plan_id      = "default"
}

resource "duplocloud_valkey_serverless" "valkey" {
  tenant_id                = duplocloud_tenant.myapp.tenant_id
  name                     = "valkey-sl"
  description              = "my serverless valkey"
  snapshot_retention_limit = 1
  engine_version           = "7"
  kms_key_id               = "kms-keyid-arn"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `engine_version` (String) The major version of the valkey serverless engine.
- `name` (String) The short name of the serverless valkey.
- `tenant_id` (String) The GUID of the tenant that the elasticache instance will be created in.

### Optional

- `description` (String) The description for serverless valkey
- `kms_key_id` (String) The globally unique identifier for the key.
- `snapshot_retention_limit` (Number) Specify retention limit in days. Accepted values - 1-35.
- `timeouts` (Block, Optional) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--timeouts))

### Read-Only

- `actual_version` (String)
- `arn` (String) The arn of serverless valkey
- `endpoint` (String) The endpoint of the serverless valkey.
- `fullname` (String) The full name of the elasticache instance.
- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.
- `port` (Number) The listening port of the elasticache instance.
- `security_group_ids` (List of String) subnet ids allocated to serverless valkey
- `subnet_ids` (List of String) subnet ids allocated to serverless valkey

<a id="nestedblock--timeouts"></a>
### Nested Schema for `timeouts`

Optional:

- `create` (String)
- `delete` (String)
- `update` (String)

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Example: Importing an existing AWS ElastiCache Serverless Valkey
#  - *TENANT_ID* is the tenant GUID
#  - *SHORT_NAME* is the short name of the AWS Valkey
#
terraform import duplocloud_valkey_serverless.valkey *TENANT_ID*/valkey/serverless/*SHORT_NAME*
```
